document.title: Oregon Department of Education World Language Standards

B027AB1DDDA14E9FB7AA57DB1B9BE0A8.description: ● write well-organized texts for a variety of general interest purposes

6F8E7E63D13E4F92A3999EC87BE3077B.description: ● write well-organized texts for a variety of professional purposes

2058FA2794B5410195E4B89B53268AA7.description: ● write well-organized texts for a variety of academic purposes

B4C825853D524C199E02D6EEECF17E69.description: ● give presentations with ease and detail on a wide

D9A0880F44404A8082252D3A1DCFABE0.description: ● convey their ideas and elaborate on a variety of academic topics

F65FA0F178704EFFBB5E4851F7ECF6D3.description: ● present information about events of public or personal interest

6B605B585AAE4C079BC772507F14076F.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can speak, sign or write to give detailed presentations, narrate events, and present arguments, with supporting evidence about personal experience, community events, academic, concrete, and professional topics of interest using organized, paragraph-length discourse across major time frames.

E572F9B5B9BB4C8EA66739BD1DFFD40B.description: ● handle a complication or unexpected turn of events

DA74E0078F674CB4BC8D56359F8DB019.description: ● exchange general information on topics outside their fields of interest

52CD861C5909447781E9CA9BA2CDBE9B.description: ● communicate effectively on a wide variety of present, past, and future events

5DA16FB45B464E55B8490CB80E0349C1.description:
Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can maintain extended conversations and discussions, provide detailed explanations, make comparisons, express advice and emotions across major time frames about familiar and unfamiliar concrete, academic and social topics using paragraph-length discourse. 

Learners can negotiate and resolve an unexpected complication that arises in familiar situations by providing detailed explanations and  a variety of solutions.

91F7007596D840F6AB1339C949756948.description: ● understand general information on topics outside their field of interest

EF7442C5A7914B72AA875919E43E2A47.description: ● understand directions and instructions on everyday tasks follow the general idea and some details of what is written in a variety of stories and autobiographical accounts

91F8E70AF8FB46F28A4B068FFD6551ED.description: ● understand the main idea and many details of descriptions or interviews

D165325548244969805E00E54A9341FE.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/Reading): Learners can follow and understand the main story, underlying message, and most supporting details from a variety of familiar and general interest topics across major time frames from spoken, signed, or written texts.

2B4D0AC583334F38A2F8C9703A5962B8.description:
ADVANCED HIGH LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to…
- understand, exchange, and present information across major time frames to communicate about a wide variety of familiar and unfamiliar general interest topics by using organized, paragraph-length discourse.
- interact with others and negotiate to resolve a complication in familiar and unfamiliar contexts by providing detailed explanations and  a variety of solutions.

C0C2FB74C270489B8ECD695183109D72.description: ● meet basic social and civic writing needs

E74919DA5D854B16AEA77A95AF2BC67C.description: ● meet basic work and career writing needs

35BD4BDDB69D4C18B917D4984869D213.description: ● meet basic school and academic writing needs

B59FAC5BFDBC4625AC727924547FC2E2.description: ● deliver presentations for a specific audience

875C2156A72C467391EF9A3DAC83D192.description: ● explain issues of public and community interest, including different viewpoints

69FEDC70904C49669CD9C1E5984460B3.description: ● deliver short presentations on social and cultural topics

43F33C8058AF4840B2ACEBD8FFE408CC.description: ● deliver short presentations on a number of academic and workplace topics

0282F72F21074DBD8ACDC300F27B3D4B.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can speak, sign or write to give detailed presentations, narrate events, and state viewpoints with supporting evidence about personal experiences, community events, some academic, concrete, and professional topics of interest using paragraph-length discourse across major time frames.

49549B4D29BD4F8DB9B1E2376D3B1FCF.description: ● resolve an unexpected complication that arises in a familiar situation

CA9A44659FD64A39AEDD57ABEA35639D.description: ● compare and contrast life in different locations and in different time periods

25910CB9485A448C832255011FACD527.description: ● participate in conversations on a wide variety of topics that go beyond their everyday lives

E2CD63B9A6FD41C7AB39B288D84BBE75.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can maintain conversations, exchange information, provide explanation, and make comparisons across major time frames about familiar and concrete, academic and social topics using paragraph-length discourse. Learners can negotiate and resolve an unexpected complication that arises in familiar situations.

7D327AAFF10849D1AD556A2DED9F0667.description: ● read texts that compare and contrast information

283CAE84E3E34C04825656689D9CF019.description: ● find and use information for practical purposes

FCEBBE1049A3459DA81B345D51C709F0.description: ● understand the main idea of popular genres

16FA07BB55D640428A66F7D8333EAB7D.description: ● understand descriptions and stories of events that have happened or will happen

AE07EAE71B144A8DA4EE15D6C9A76A81.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/Reading): Learners can follow and understand the main story, underlying message, and some supporting details from a variety of familiar and general interest topics across major time frames from spoken, signed, or written texts.

E80DE0C2C38844E69C9F869B4F5B1DB1.description:
ADVANCED MID LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to…
- understand, exchange, and present information across major time frames to communicate about a wide variety of familiar and unfamiliar general interest topics by using organized, paragraph-length discourse.
- interact with others and negotiate to resolve a complication in familiar and unfamiliar contexts by providing detailed explanations and  a variety of solutions.

19AE3C1C5D4E439EAFC6A480B59576DA.description: ● meet basic social and civic writing needs

503C2800B7C24CD4A9B7ECF62EF66D33.description: ● meet basic work and career writing needs

BECFCB7385EF4DA784C89F5DC17723BA.description: ● meet basic school and academic writing needs

425CF3AE461F43EC96B2E5FD2500E74A.description: ● deliver presentations for a specific audience

09930BE0B71A4A9AAB2C5C98B94C427E.description: ● explain issues of public and community interest, including different viewpoints

12A4CD743DFA46E38B478852296D8370.description: ● deliver short presentations on social and cultural topics

1FD4C246EDA44C3F9207634EF80E1D4F.description: ● deliver short presentations on a number of academic and workplace topics

4CA981A496A14ADA8CE5CE6F0D89304E.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can speak, sign or write to give detailed presentations, narrate events, and state viewpoints with supporting evidence about personal experiences, community events, some academic, concrete, and professional topics of interest using paragraph-length discourse across major time frames.

2F1B3EBB074148A2ACABDF5AA0BDAE14.description: ● resolve an unexpected complication that arises in a familiar situation

54AAA4CCAA6444AFB29D66564EDC1485.description: ● compare and contrast life in different locations and in different time periods

5997373A7B7545118247B80D2C4AB213.description: ● participate in conversations on a wide variety of topics that go beyond their everyday lives

AF17547CDA654AB4B78BEA439C4D09D5.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can maintain conversations, exchange information, provide explanation, and make comparisons across major time frames about familiar and concrete, academic and social topics using paragraph-length discourse. Learners can negotiate and resolve an unexpected complication that arises in familiar situations.

25C445F55914490D9CFCB6A99F37277D.description: ● read texts that compare and contrast information

3E1C12803AF74E59BAF2FA8F32D43471.description: ● find and use information for practical purposes

C4106F5A42A3431AB76B660CCEBE65B6.description: ● understand the main idea of popular genres

638BED83E29248CCA252E1B4545F0B9A.description: ● understand descriptions and stories of events that have happened or will happen

6AC28D9838D445358B1C80CA9570F648.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/Reading): Learners can follow and understand the main story, underlying message, and some supporting details from a variety of familiar and general interest topics across major time frames from spoken, signed, or written texts.

1B9C32A952A5428D9FC08DC022624295.description:
ADVANCED LOW LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to…
- understand, exchange, and present information across major time frames to communicate about a range of familiar and concrete topics by using paragraph-length discourse.
- interact with others and negotiate to resolve a complication in familiar and unfamiliar contexts.

EC52A95AF9FF4D70BE49FDDB99446A22.description: ● write about an entertainment or social event

FE267DE7968B4C72B1E463EC68741AD3.description: ● write about community topics and events

DEF47623E6474DA088D3C1B360D10BBB.description: ● write about work and career topics

0AA87DDD263D484CA29C6410C3E314FA.description: ● write about school and academic topics

1589255D923B497FBFCE0B871748015E.description: ● present their points of view and provide reasons to support them

F13D0CDA0F9141AE98B573CA77D98369.description: ● make a presentation on events, activities, and topics of particular interest

65AE78F5A58A47EF82BE696DC94895D7.description: ● present information on concrete topics that are researched

D96C03A66FC14BC2B13D52354D271201.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can speak, sign, or write to give detailed presentations and to narrate events with some supporting information about familiar and some researched, concrete topics using a few short paragraphs, across various time frames.

01D06D2E41DB48F1995DEE02D1AA9022.description: ● use their language to handle a situation that may have a complication

E22B6DBF6D644D5D949BDC8003222081.description: ● use their language to do a task that requires multiple steps

71F318588E2B439A95D7158471BE3E38.description: ● exchange information related to areas of mutual interest

1A2B8405C62640A5B0868377F99E0898.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can interact with others to exchange information and to meet needs in a variety of situations (sometimes involving a complication) by using connected discourse about a range of familiar and some concrete topics across various time frames.

6D222EC091F7436283853FE99FC41190.description: ● understand the main idea of and a few supporting facts about famous people and historical events

5DD810AF5E4D4C0CA5CA83DBCC6A8793.description: ● sometimes follow short, written instructions when supported by visuals

1EFCA6DE58A94FA595CE476922AE3EB3.description: ● understand accounts of personal events or experiences

65BF259C20F14B178D6AF7C24F595A67.description: ● sometimes understand situations with complicating factors

C49BF0B0DF0B4109B39EAFB2B7E8CE52.description: ● understand a few details in ads, announcements, and other simple recordings

04EEFFC43DC24F8AB7C046DE9C785D3F.description: ● easily understand straightforward information or interactions

A1A38E253DAE4751A8B169ECEE5DB006.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/Reading): Learners can comprehend the main message or story and a few details across various time frames in paragraph-length texts about a range of familiar topics in a variety of spoken, written, or signed contexts.

2ACD287B0DB444A68A30EB9CFE2F85D4.description:
INTERMEDIATE HIGH LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to... - understand, exchange, and present information (often across various time frames) to communicate about a range of familiar and some concrete topics of interest by creating connected sentences and short paragraphs.
- interact with others to meet needs (sometimes with a complication) in personal and social contexts.

54ACEC8BF96E478DB0CD61F555C66593.description: ● write short reports about something they have learned or researched

1D977AD93DB9441396566CA4238EEA50.description: ● make a presentation about common interests and issues and state their viewpoint

BAF3AB062A0845AFA287CECA333D94CF.description: ● make a presentation on something they have learned or researched

24915F51001A4DC4BFF695A91E746D97.description: ● make a presentation about their personal and social experiences

9655CF1760F84028973A3F23E6003222.description:
Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing):
Learners can speak, sign, or write to make presentations about  familiar and some researched concrete topics, express viewpoints, and tell a personal story using a series of connected sentences and questions.

BB4B0DD3D87D4AD9A4611BE15F607409.description: ● exchange information about subjects of special interest to them

6C7DB5EFC6824586AF74104612B9FC3A.description: ● use their language to handle tasks related to their personal needs

414BF03EC48A4EE780C95B6CA713F6DE.description: ● talk about their daily activities and personal preferences

EF3AA9800DF24F2AA66E8D5D002E486B.description: ● request or exchange information on a variety of familiar topics

578E7D77DB804869AADDEEFE59CEB6F1.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can interact with others to request and exchange information, meet needs, express preferences, opinions, or feelings, and provide basic advice by creating strings of original sentences, and questions on familiar and some researched topics in personal and social contexts.

9978EAC92EB34215A56BCDAA4E621516.description: ● read simple written exchanges between other people

BB956401398C407B9C8D8E521847510D.description: ● understand the main idea of what they read for personal enjoyment

FB59A16F31C740A39C6227FF5273CCC8.description: ● understand basic information in ads, announcements, and other simple texts

E7C278A4849C4B4B90A6A5EA2B745613.description: ● understand messages related to their everyday life

A9CCCD88C88A45A582A4A907EA6F8677.description: ● understand the main idea of what they listen to for personal enjoyment

7398735B65004A6A8C7877CFFB8AAFE2.description: ● understand basic information in ads, announcements, and other simple recordings

050F2FB4B7D742F89878592A4F817341.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/Reading): Learners can comprehend the main idea and extract key information in spoken, written, or signed texts about a range of familiar topics in personal and social contexts.

C1D345CE969041738A8C9BD80AA43E46.description: INTERMEDIATE MID LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to... - understand, exchange, and present information to communicate about familiar topics and to meet practical needs in personal and social contexts by creating original sentences, strings of sentences, and questions.

B61C0F8638CB4BC1A46D4C28A7C13064.description: ● write basic instructions on how to make or do something

28798B69419F4F7182CFD71A53273137.description: ● write about people, activities, events and experiences

99302393EAB944C98E5A156213DF7DB7.description: ● express their preferences on topics of interest

A7D927E0F0034D36926192C6A6F52D6A.description: ● present songs, short skits, or dramatic readings

6DC7C79F7D7E4149B101EAFC8BC4CEAC.description: ● present information on plans, instructions, and directions

FC6297578D8C49BF861E27F1E689DD4C.description: ● talk about people, activities, events, and experiences

01FAAF551E144385B3BA4127F99DC616.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can speak, sign, or write to communicate information and express preferences about familiar topics in personal and social contexts by creating simple, original sentences and questions.

C5182A2407BE4E888A87611E98436B6E.description: ● use the language to meet their basic needs in familiar situations

F37BFD98A25E43988452CEC828BC7346.description: ● ask and answer questions on factual information that is familiar to them

D45F250B01174BC1B9E28C83FF73942B.description: ● have a simple conversation on a number of everyday topics

E515BB0784354A5D9282205CEC5C560D.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can interact with others to request and exchange information, meet basic needs, and express preferences or feelings by creating simple, original sentences and questions about familiar topics in personal and social contexts.

53FF296B0A8747F582A8E6B47C146954.description: ● identify some information from news media

CB8651EE64434B88B980B348FCA86F31.description: ● identify some simple information needed on forms

6A98A05CAA3946E0ADD0260C3761279D.description: ●understand messages in which the writer tells or asks the learner about topics of personal interest

279ED905B902456CBAAF503717696E8C.description: ● understand questions and simple statements on everyday topics when learners are part of the conversation

70CA6BA4BA654CF7A47BD9ABEBC1F0C3.description: ● understand messages related to their basic needs

4C48EFE78F8D44B9B5261DEF3FE42471.description: ● understand the basic purpose of a message

9AA4CEF1CC7A48FBA1D8ABAB4BADB170.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/Reading): Learners can comprehend the main idea and identify some supporting information in spoken, written, and signed texts about familiar topics in personal and social contexts.

8545859A45F74952AF689B7E3FABDFA6.description: INTERMEDIATE LOW LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to...- understand, exchange, and present information to communicate about familiar topics and to meet practical needs in personal and social contexts by consistently creating simple, original sentences and questions.

067A183B1B884A6597CB991E9699D5E3.description: ● write basic information about things they have learned

24AE2D5EAB3F465DAA1017C7BFD52F3D.description: ● write about a familiar experience or event using practiced material

FD9BD61466D74C8EAFF4B8221FB3E39B.description: ● write short notes using phrases and simple sentences

FA2ABF12568248B882632BE71A71E230.description: ●write information about their daily life in a letter, blog, discussion board, or email message

7E52CEF462B6464DA1A2FA9E26D3C373.description: ● present basic information about a familiar person, place, or thing using phrases and simple sentences

B785F53D7A4C4B4BA319D0C8F12E93B1.description: ● tell about a familiar experience or event using phrases and simple sentences

77E1FD5E938941CFB75F8FD9E65497EE.description: ● present information about their life using phrases and simple sentences

FB47045D233745BE9DB54EE5E4E6E110.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/ Writing): Learners can speak, sign, or write to provide information about familiar topics in everyday contexts using a variety of rehearsed and some original, simple sentences and questions.

C2CBA37A01C7443FB12A99EB0BB32ADC.description: ● interact with others in everyday situations

A052C41DCEC440C48D36FB7B7C652774.description: ● ask for and give simple directions

41469552BFF245F99ACEF16ABD151829.description: ● exchange information using texts, graphs, or pictures

62CC08FED3B04DDD8C13FC1BA113A30B.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can interact with others to request and exchange information, meet basic needs, and express preferences or feelings by using a variety of rehearsed and some original, simple sentences and questions about very familiar topics in everyday contexts.

0D37BF127154475CB5FEDC12A256B478.description: ● understand simple everyday notices in public places on topics that are familiar to them

72BE00EF84964CA2BF59921D7D635934.description: ● sometimes understand the main idea of published materials

790B88AA1CD845B9803ED51E15D36909.description: ● sometimes understand short, simple descriptions with the help of pictures or graphs

FDAFDCF347B4492D8D30AC802C91A764.description: ● usually understand short simple messages on familiar topics

3097C0145CC445BE81AD9E54E410F8A5.description: ● sometimes understand the main topic of conversation that they overhear

00A12DDD65FA4DBBBD11B51A90A627DE.description: ● understand simple information when presented with pictures and graphs

F8E2C0EE9D474896B5E03F7FF3FF2356.description: ● sometimes understand simple questions or statements on familiar topics

218CC020C979411FA15692CE32879E9F.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/ Reading): Learners can identify the topic and understand some isolated facts and information from spoken, written, or signed texts about a limited range of familiar topics in everyday contexts.

F80ED8AFEA214066B59EE9D195D08A89.description: NOVICE HIGH LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to... - understand, exchange, and present information about familiar topics in everyday contexts using a variety of rehearsed or memorized words and phrases with some simple, original sentences and questions.

18ED6D4B7A0548ADBB54249418CCC4D1.description: ● write notes about something they have learned using lists, phrases, and memorized expressions

88D8541BF3604462A64DBBD044DE3DAF.description: ● list their daily activities and write lists that help them in their day-to-day life

032F809C8EA344DD9233B83128A71092.description: ● write about themselves using learned phrases and memorized expressions

ACE16AD4EA3046E4824B0E4820408628.description: ● fill out a simple form with some basic personal information

062C11A960F4438499DF912F09375793.description: ● use words, phrases, and memorized expressions

3A17B25D6DFD486DB35383654D312BBE.description: ● present simple information about something they learned

A6242DA0E7034A8EB2813F0F8E04C6E6.description: ● talk about their daily activities using words, phrases, and memorized expressions

65027C5233B9455ABFDFF01FA5CDBB2C.description: ● present information about familiar items in their immediate environment

014F16EEDA25466980D8CB040234A494.description: ● express their likes and dislikes using words, phrases, and memorized expressions

827E97E696B34C31822ACF08715E0429.description: ● present information about themselves and others using words and phrases

172C85475FDC4C4C853E3E4337082D03.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing):Learners can speak, sign, or write to provide information about personal and very familiar topics in everyday contexts using rehearsed or memorized words, phrases, simple sentences, and questions.

4F82731AAE544CE4AFCA87D0E419715A.description: ● communicate some basic information about their everyday lives

5AC543B1E0B04418B4AAF5DF9CD72DE0.description: ● communicate basic information about self and people they know

C0B11BCFC6F3428689A68FA53B828A7B.description: ● make some simple statements in a conversation

D9D86D2BCE7E4255A63D205E7BFFC2C5.description: ● answer a variety of simple questions

DAFD10B65518419D8D49E697FA2E24E7.description: ● greet and leave people in a polite way

14420A3B421E44FFB1218050E65A4E77.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can request and exchange information and express basic needs, preferences, or feelings by using a variety of rehearsed or memorized words, phrases, simple sentences, and questions on very familiar topics in everyday contexts.

D7EF41E9A69340088D647E749380395A.description: ● recognize words, phrases, and characters when they associate them with things they already know

7A756B22F83A45A997212C998848BCC9.description: ●recognize words, phrases, and characters with the help of visuals

2162FF4437934052A54BFC5874A98105.description: ● recognize and sometimes understand words and phrases that they have learned for specific purposes

EB571AC2AE6E49D189ED27BF639100E9.description: ● recognize and sometimes understand basic information in words and phrases that they have memorized

F62E66359F244F22A9E44306EAA496CF.description: ● understand a few culturally appropriate courtesy phrases.

2726F055DE39499CA264A4E020CC64B6.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/ Reading): Learners can identify and understand some basic information from spoken, written, or signed texts about a limited range of familiar topics in everyday contexts.

1E34EB974E50494380B83ED35BD59B55.description: NOVICE MID LEVEL can use the target language and cultural knowledge to...- understand, exchange, and present basic information and short messages about very familiar topics in everyday contexts using a variety of rehearsed or memorized words, phrases, and simple sentences and questions.

BB82ECC364144D1EA5DD4F4FC5CE426E.description: ● label familiar people, places, and objects in pictures and posters

79DE471A8C9142EDB2DFE21ADAEFF602.description: ● write words and phrases that they have learned

4B7BC10AE1B746329C1D25D110AF6714.description: ● copy some characters or letters and words that they see on the wall or board, in a book, or on the computer

66181B633CFA43A881FCBE3DD7153A47.description: ● state the names of familiar people, places, and objects in pictures and posters using words or memorized phrases

D468ED318AC14ADD8F8C145934BC6C22.description: ● recite words and phrases that they have learned

519F4980EA2C448B8B05D7BC701E36CB.description: Presentational Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can speak, sign, or write to provide information about self in everyday contexts relevant to their lives using rehearsed or memorized words and basic phrases.

493862DE00B04079B40A4ED403BFC3B2.description: Interpersonal Mode (Speaking/Signing/Writing): Learners can exchange basic information and express some basic needs, preferences, or feelings by using rehearsed or memorized words, phrases, simple sentences, and questions on a limited range of familiar topics in everyday contexts.

9F9B6F11164B47318BC353D370C20484.description: ● connect some words, phrases, or characters to their meanings

9DE35F389BB844B3A289E2E9AD5A841B.description: ● recognize a few letters or characters

4EAD6EAD402243D597966EFDB8EE7D40.description: ● occasionally understand isolated words that have been memorized, particularly when accompanied by gestures or pictures

00981A6ECD3E42DE9EEBA0434BDD0C88.description: ● occasionally identify the sound of a character or a word

678F0B68348143E98354DA67E0F4A9FE.description: Interpretive Mode (Listening/Comprehension/Reading):Learners can recognize and identify a few words, signs, phrases, cognates, and simple statements from highly predictable spoken, written, or signed texts on a limited range of very familiar topics in everyday contexts.

EE064D3D70FB4DD98D52614E3D61B7A7.description: NOVICE LOW LEVEL can use target language and cultural knowledge to...- understand, exchange, and present basic information about highly predictable everyday topics using a variety of rehearsed or memorized words and phrases
